content: it s included in the gusset chart so you can follow just that in the decrease row the change between the first and second colour groups will move over by two pairs rather than by just one because of this when you pick up the second group of yarns you ll carry them past two pairs of stitches rather than one before you start using them in row 7 before you rearrange stitches to prepare for the decrease the second group of yarns will be in the middle of the two pairs for this decrease drop the first group of yarns slip two stitches pick up the second group of yarns slip 1 with yarn in back slip 1 with yarn in front drop the second group of yarns slip those 4 stitches back do the decrease as normal foot after the final gusset row move onto the foot beginning with row 8 if your colourwork pattern isn t quite right and some of the diagonal stripes are too wide/too narrow keep them at that size for a few more row when you reach row 12 of the footchart gobacktofollowingthechart to weave in ends pick one group of yarns to use to close the hole thread one onto a tapestry needle and then move it around the outside/front of needles picking through each of the front-layer stitches thread the other onto the tapestry needle moving around the inside/back of the needles where the hole is pick through each of the back-layer stitches now that each stitch is on one of the two threads you can remove the needles tie a loose overhand knot with the two ends used for closing and pass one through the hole to the inside of the sock reaching your hand up into the sock pull on the two ends of yarn to close the hole weave in your ends and enjoy 5 the second sock to make the second sock repeat everything you just did �� if you want the second sock to spiral in the opposite
